sentences.sContent: a house in a pleasant suburban district
sentences.sCn: 地处宜人郊区的一幢房屋

sentences.sContent: ...A lawyer from the district attorney’s office presents a case against the suspect...
...The district manager is the key to the success of the sales representatives in his district...

...A study in one Texas school district compared the lunches of fourth graders who did not have food choices with those of fifth graders who could choose either a standard lunch or select from a snack-bar...
...One school district in New York decided to do something about it...
...She went to work at that wealthy school district next door — for less money...
...He decided to end the meeting with the conversation about the importance of the district managers to the company’s plans...
...Alex Gordon was looking forward to his first meeting with the company’s district managers...

phrases.pCn: 哥伦比亚特区（美国联邦直辖区）
联邦特区（联邦政府所在地区，等于Federal District）

trans.tranOther: an area of a town or the countryside, especially one with particular features
